items.title: [2025.07.07] Game Server Maintenance. New Client Version 12.9.3!
items.description:
Greetings, Warriors!
 

We're excited to announce that the new client update to version 12.9.3 will be available for download tomorrow, 08.07.25, at 13:00 CEST. This update will include the following changes:
 

Non-Class Skills

  • Adjusted the Book of Restrained Control: The skill's effect is now removed as soon as the character's health reaches or exceeds the threshold. However, the skill itself won't go on cooldown when this happens

Overhauled First-Time Experience

  • Improvements to the Worn Pages quest: Now, only one instance of the Nameless One can appear in the area at a time, but you'll still be able to summon the demon again if needed
  • A new visual effect will now highlight when pirate remains can be interacted with during the Tides of War quest
  • Monster placement and the location layout have been refined for the second stage of the Forge of the Gods quest
  • Increased the minimum display time for pop-up messages about quest stages, experience gains, and level-ups

Settings Menu

  • Added a new option to toggle pop-up messages for quest-related events
  • Added a new option to toggle chat messages for quest-related events

Other Changes

  • Fixed a bug where characters could respawn at an inactive Respawn Statue
  • The following interactive objects now display their names: Dark Thicket Captain, Pirate Captain, and Heavenly Captain in Ayvondil, as well as the Portals to the Forge of the Gods

The game will be unavailable for approximately 3 hours.
 

Note that any active elixirs and minions will be paused during this time, and your Seeker's Stamina will be restored if you're in a dungeon when the maintenance begins.
 

Please plan your in-game activities accordingly and thank you for your understanding.

 

The Warspear Online Team

items.title: [2025.06.08] Activity Season 34: Changing the Rules!
items.description:
Warriors!

The 17th anniversary of Warspear Online is almost here! Get ready to celebrate this milestone with a brand-new Activity Season in Arinar! Set off on an unforgettable adventure, and don't forget to visit the Activity Center – it's filled with a variety of exciting missions! Remember that daily missions will reset at 00:00 CEST each day, and any progress made on incomplete missions will be lost. This also applies to weekly missions, which reset every Monday at 00:00 CEST.

Curious about the rewards this season? There are two holiday costumes up for grabs: Esteemed Officer or Esteemed Officeress (available in the free rewards branch) and the mystical Obscurial. You'll also unlock the prehistoric Ancientmobile skill, unique minions, and Signs of Imperishability. Plus, there are new exclusive smileys, Legendary Elixirs of Unity and Experience, holiday hairstyles, powerful buffs, keys to Pirate and Tribal Chests, Knowledge, and so much more – including the Great Legacy Chest!

Inside these chests, you'll find:

Books:

  • Book of Second Chance
  • Book of Underground Speed

Book of Second Chance
Immediately resurrects the character's minion and applies Invulnerability to it for 10 sec once per lifetime. An extra life is indicated by the icon next to the minion's health/energy bar.

Book of Underground Speed
Increases the character's movement speed in dungeons by 10%.

Costumes:

  • Snorlar Costume
  • Demonologist Costume
  • Beholder Costume
  • Bonewinged Guard Costume
  • Primordial King
  • Ehecatl
  • Maradish
  • Valariya

Eternal Forest and Cursed Lands Decorative Skins

And also:

  • Great Gladiator's, Unity, and Experience Elixirs
  • Special Combat Scrolls
  • Powerful Potions
  • Precious Bars

Ancientmobile Skill
Take a journey back to the ancient ways of traveling and leave your enemies in the dust! Cannot be used in guild events, sieges, Arenas, and underwater. Available until the end of the Activity Season.

For all those looking to earn more Season Points and reap a bounty of lavish rewards, be sure to activate the Battle Pass, which unlocks an entire branch of unique rewards! The Battle Pass also features:

  • More daily and weekly mission slots
  • Quick access to the Personal and Guild Storage
  • Free hairstyle changes at the Personal Hairdresser
  • Personal Knowledge Bank

On top of that, once you have redeemed all of your season rewards, the Battle Pass will unlock an additional reward slot containing a Great Legacy Chest for every 40 points earned! Best of all, you can redeem this chest over and over again until the end of the season!

Also, don't miss out on the opportunity to gift the Battle Pass to any character level 6 or higher within your Alliance and game realm! Try it out right from the Activity Center!

The new Activity Season begins on June 9, 00:00 CEST, and lasts through July 28, 00:00 CEST.

See you in the game!
The Warspear Online Team

items.description:
Warriors!
 

An unforgettable celebration is on the horizon – Warspear Online is turning 17! Prepare to battle formidable enemies, experience thrilling adventures, and dive into epic battles that will sweep across all of Arinar. Unravel all-new mysteries, seize your chance for glory, and etch your name into the legendary chronicles of Warspear Online!
 

Weekly Guild Tournament: Ancient Chronicles
 

Rivalry between guilds is a time-honored tradition in Arinar, and it's time to reignite that fighting spirit! All guilds level 2 and above are invited to battle for supremacy! Once the tournament begins, your guild will be placed in a group based solely on its level – regardless of Alliance affiliation – so you'll be competing against guilds of similar strength within your division.
 

Guild Distribution
 

EU-Emerald, US-Sapphire, BR-Tourmaline
Division A: Guilds from level 10-12
Division B: Guilds from level 6-9
Division C: Guilds from level 2-5
 

SEA-Pearl
Division A: Guilds from level 4-12
Division B: Guilds from level 2-3
 

RU-Amber, RU-Topaz, RU-Ruby
Division A: Guilds from level 10-12
Division B: Guilds from level 6-9
Division C: Guilds from level 2-5
 

Gain Knowledge through various in-game activities to help your guild come out on top and earn unique personal rewards at the end of the week! Each weekly event brings exclusive tournament rewards tailored to the week's special theme.


Remember, if a player joins a guild but leaves during the tournament, the points earned by that player will be deducted from the guild's overall score. To see how your guild is performing, go to the Activity Center and click the Guild Statistics button under the Guild Tournament menu.
 

World Event: Storm of Bones
 

Ever since Er-Sahil opened its harbors to travelers, more and more sun-drenched adventurers from Almahad have set foot on Irselnort. Mysterious foreign visitors are now the talk of every tavern, and their true motives remain unknown. For the defenders of Arinar, vigilance is more important than ever – not all guests come in peace...
 

Stage I: Blazing Fury
The Mage's Guild of Almahad treasures its ancient relics, but not all mages honor the old ways. Once one of their own, Tasa'akh the Unbound has stolen a unique artifact – the Oracle's Staff – which carries a formidable power, whispering to its bearer. For the strong-willed, its murmurs bring prophecy, but for Tasa'akh, the voices brought madness. Now under the staff's influence, he has fled to Irselnort, spreading chaos in his wake. His escape from Nadir-Sard has disturbed the local elementals, igniting them into a frenzy of flame. Extinguish the uprising before the city is reduced to ash!
 

Stage II: Sandsnare
The Oracle's Staff continues to cloud Tasa'akh's mind with even darker thoughts, pushing him deeper into insanity. As he flees, he leaves behind deadly traps powered by runic stones scattered across the land. To survive the raging sandstorm, you must destroy the elemental energy locked within these stones. Fight off the furious wild boars – they're none too pleased with this unnatural weather!
 


 

Stage III: True Companion
The crazed sorcerer has vanished without a trace – but hope is not lost. The Mage's Guild has sent its finest tracker to hunt down Tasa'akh, a gifted hound with a nose for the scent of relics and curses. Protect the dog as it follows Tasa'akh's fading trail!


Stage IV: Tasa'akh the Unbound
The Oracle's Staff has fully consumed Tasa'akh, turning him from a man into a wild beast! Prepare to face the ultimate threat and defend Irselnort from total destruction!
 


 

Tournament Guild Event in a GvG Area: Lava Archipelago
 

The undying fury of flame calls once more! Snorlar has summoned Arinar's battle-hardened guilds for a blazing new challenge. On the Lava Archipelago, your mission is simple: defeat as many creatures of fire and ash as possible and prove your guild's supremacy in this scorching trial!
 

Once again, the ground trembles beneath the weight of monstrous fiends born of flame and ash. This time, you and your guildmates will journey to the Lava Archipelago, where Snorlar awaits in his volcanic stronghold. The road ahead won't be easy! Prepare for a heated battle as the most fearsome fireborn creatures rise from the earth's depths. Show your guild's unmatched strength by defeating as many of Snorlar’s minions as possible. With every formidable foe you defeat, an even greater enemy will appear – so stay sharp! Strike down terrifying monsters and rival guild members alike to push your guild closer to victory.
 

When the event begins, you'll appear at one of six military camps. Special ferrymen will be ready to transport you – either directly to the heart of the Lava Archipelago, at the foot of a colossal volcano, or to one of the distant islands connected by a network of bridges and crossings. Just remember: the ferrymen stationed on the islands require a small payment – a coin from a pouch of gold that can be found on-site.
 


 

Your first objective is to reach the center of the archipelago, where Snorlar lurks within the volcano's fiery maw. Stone barriers protect his blazing lair, but true warriors of Arinar will find a way through! Defeating Snorlar will earn your guild valuable points and awaken the archipelago's legendary fire monsters: Flamegullet, Baldrazar, and Gorefiend.
 


 

Each time one of these three bosses is defeated, catastrophic natural disasters will sweep across their island – or the entire archipelago. Be ready to turn these chaotic events to your advantage and earn even more points for your guild!
 

Claim victory by outscoring rival guilds and earning points through various activities:

  • Kill an enemy player – 1 point
  • Kill a Snorlar's Protector – 5 points
  • Kill Flamegullet – 100 points
  • Kill Gorefiend – 250 points
  • Kill Baldrazar – 400 points
  • Kill Snorlar – 750 points

Competitive Guild Raids
 

With the release of Update 12.9, two brand-new rotating guild raids are coming to the game – completely independent of seasonal events! Set in the Golden Sands of Almahad and the Ship Graveyard of Ayvondil, each raid features 15 difficulty levels.
 

Rotating Competitive Guild Raid: Chasing the Wind
 

Rumors have long echoed across the island of the Chainless League about a winged bandit lord known as Argus – a ruthless raider who tears across the blazing dunes of the Golden Sands in a lightning-fast warcart, leaving behind plundered caravans and choking dust. His name is a warning, and the shadow of wings overhead is an omen of doom for anyone daring to cross the desert. Now, it's your turn to face Argus and his relentless gang in this thrilling new competitive raid!
 

They say the desert has two curses: sandstorms and Argus. Many bold adventurers, lured by the promise of treasures buried beneath the dunes, have fallen to the blades of Argus and his ruthless crew. But Argus is no ordinary outlaw – he wields forbidden magic that allows him to control the minds of birds, bending them to his will. Countless caravans have been looted by his hand, their remains now buried under sun-scorched sands.
 

From the very start of this high-speed desert pursuit, your guild will come under siege. Argus's henchmen will attempt to board your warcart using harpoons and grappling hooks. You must destroy these siege tools to repel the attackers – but don't get too comfortable! Argus doesn't take defeat lightly, and when his minions fail, he'll descend from the skies himself to confront you himself.
 

As the battle unfolds, Argus will attempt to divide your guild by marking each player with either a purple or orange aura. These color marks, shown as large icons in your character's widget, are crucial to survival. Choosing the wrong color at the wrong time can result in instant death – not just for you, but for your entire raid party. Meanwhile, Argus will summon deadly impact zones aboard the cart that cause damage over time. The only way to escape? Take to the skies and shutter the crystals hidden above!
 

 

Throughout the raid, two portals will appear, giving a limited number of players access to the back of a colossal bird soaring above the battlefield. There, your objective is to destroy the thunder crystals. Shattering them causes the crystals to crash down onto the cart, dealing heavy damage to Argus and absorbing harmful effects afflicting your guildmates. But beware: if Argus is too weakened – or if all players aboard the cart die – the bird will drop its passengers back down to the ground.
 

As the battle progresses, Argus will apply Electrification, a stacking debuff that increases the damage you take with every hit. Each stack of Electrification increases incoming damage by 0.5%, up to a maximum of 50% at 100 stacks. Even the toughest warriors will feel the sting! Fortunately, the thunder crystals can help counteract this effect. Keep track of your current Electrification level on the personal progress bar at the top of your screen.
 

Argus grows stronger with each difficulty level, and only the boldest heroes will be able to defeat him at the highest levels! And remember: all mechanics from the Golden Sands of Almahad are fully active during the raid.
 

Rotating Competitive Guild Raid: Horrors of the Deep
 

Ayvondil calls you to brave the abyss! Beneath the ocean's iron-gray waves lies an immense and fearsome world whose secrets are shrouded in darkness. No one truly knows what dwells at the heart of these depths... but soon, every warrior of Arinar will have the chance to uncover the truth – or be swallowed by darkness forever.
 

The waters of Ayvondil hide many chilling secrets. Old legends speak of Akumai, the terror of the deep who lurks in darkness beyond the reach of sunlight. This monstrous being conjures whirlpool traps, swallowing ships whole and dragging them to their doom. To defeat Akumai is no easy feat! Only the most resourceful and courageous heroes stand a chance of triumphing – and living to tell the tale.
 

Your journey begins on a tiny island amidst the raging waters – your guild's final refuge before venturing beneath the waves. Two teleporters will carry your guild into the shallow waters, but your true destination lies far deeper, in the shadowy depths. From the shallow waters, look for special air barrel teleporters to dive into the depths. To support these underwater journeys, oxygen consumption has been halved in all underwater locations.
 

In this underwater raid, your most vital resource is Sanity! Each hero begins the raid with a personal Sanity meter set to 50, with a maximum of 100. The deeper you travel, the faster your Sanity will drain. If it drops to zero, you'll be ejected back to Sanctuary Isle. While Sanity will slowly recover on land, it's wise to manage it carefully underwater. Defeating sea monsters in the shallow waters will help restore Sanity to everyone in your party.
 


 

Lurking in the shadowy depths awaits the colossal Akumai. To defeat this leviathan, you must breach its defenses – a daunting task. Each of Akumai's Eyes peers into your soul, summoning waves of unique monsters to protect it. Stay alert – each Eye may summon different threats, so be ready to adapt your tactics! Once an Eye is destroyed, you'll unlock a passage to Akumai's Heart, but only a limited number of heroes can enter.
 

At the core of Akumai pulses the very heart of Ayvondil's depths. Only true heroes will survive this deadly chamber! The Heart unleashes deadly beams of energy, striking down intruders, and at times, it releases bursts of power that deal damage and stun anyone who strays too close. Remember, you can only leave the Heart's chamber by dying... or if your Sanity drops to zero.
 

Akumai's Heart grows stronger with each increasing raid difficulty, but Arinar's champions are up to the challenge of the abyss!
 

Open-World Guild Events
 

The legendary bosses – the Avenger, the Demonologist, and the Beholder – are back and ready to challenge the guilds of Arinar! Complete the required objectives to activate each event and set out on an epic quest to bring these villains to justice!
 

Deadly Stare
 

A spawn of Chaos, the Beholder was once held captive by Berengar himself. With his disappearance, the Beholder was freed and now lurks deep within the caverns of Irselnort, poised to wreak havoc on the island. Calling upon his kin in the Abyss, the Beholder has unleashed an invasion of Chaos upon the lands of Irselnort! The only way to silence his malevolent summons is to face the Beholder and kill him!

EU-Emerald, US-Sapphire, BR-Tourmaline
Division A: Guilds from level 10-12
Division B: Guilds from level 6-9
Division C: Guilds from level 2-5

Mysterious foreign visitors are now the talk of every tavern, and their true motives remain unknown. For the strong-willed, its murmurs bring prophecy, but for Tasa'akh, the voices brought madness. Now under the staff's influence, he has fled to Irselnort, spreading chaos in his wake. His escape from Nadir-Sard has disturbed the local elementals, igniting them into a frenzy of flame. Extinguish the uprising before the city is reduced to ash!
 

Stage II: Sandsnare
The Oracle's Staff continues to cloud Tasa'akh's mind with even darker thoughts, pushing him deeper into insanity. As he flees, he leaves behind deadly traps powered by runic stones scattered across the land. To survive the raging sandstorm, you must destroy the elemental energy locked within these stones. Fight off the furious wild boars – they're none too pleased with this unnatural weather!
 


 

Stage III: True Companion
The crazed sorcerer has vanished without a trace – but hope is not lost. The Mage's Guild has sent its finest tracker to hunt down Tasa'akh, a gifted hound with a nose for the scent of relics and curses. Protect the dog as it follows Tasa'akh's fading trail!


Stage IV: Tasa'akh the Unbound
The Oracle's Staff has fully consumed Tasa'akh, turning him from a man into a wild beast! Prepare to face the ultimate threat and defend Irselnort from total destruction!

The undying fury of flame calls once more! Snorlar has summoned Arinar's battle-hardened guilds for a blazing new challenge. On the Lava Archipelago, your mission is simple: defeat as many creatures of fire and ash as possible and prove your guild's supremacy in this scorching trial!
 

Once again, the ground trembles beneath the weight of monstrous fiends born of flame and ash. Prepare for a heated battle as the most fearsome fireborn creatures rise from the earth's depths. Show your guild's unmatched strength by defeating as many of Snorlar’s minions as possible. When the event begins, you'll appear at one of six military camps.   • Kill Snorlar – 750 points

Rumors have long echoed across the island of the Chainless League about a winged bandit lord known as Argus – a ruthless raider who tears across the blazing dunes of the Golden Sands in a lightning-fast warcart, leaving behind plundered caravans and choking dust. His name is a warning, and the shadow of wings overhead is an omen of doom for anyone daring to cross the desert. They say the desert has two curses: sandstorms and Argus. Many bold adventurers, lured by the promise of treasures buried beneath the dunes, have fallen to the blades of Argus and his ruthless crew. From the very start of this high-speed desert pursuit, your guild will come under siege. Argus's henchmen will attempt to board your warcart using harpoons and grappling hooks. You must destroy these siege tools to repel the attackers – but don't get too comfortable! Argus doesn't take defeat lightly, and when his minions fail, he'll descend from the skies himself to confront you himself.
 

As the battle unfolds, Argus will attempt to divide your guild by marking each player with either a purple or orange aura. These color marks, shown as large icons in your character's widget, are crucial to survival. Choosing the wrong color at the wrong time can result in instant death – not just for you, but for your entire raid party. Meanwhile, Argus will summon deadly impact zones aboard the cart that cause damage over time. The only way to escape? Take to the skies and shutter the crystals hidden above!
 

 

Throughout the raid, two portals will appear, giving a limited number of players access to the back of a colossal bird soaring above the battlefield. There, your objective is to destroy the thunder crystals. Shattering them causes the crystals to crash down onto the cart, dealing heavy damage to Argus and absorbing harmful effects afflicting your guildmates. But beware: if Argus is too weakened – or if all players aboard the cart die – the bird will drop its passengers back down to the ground.
 

As the battle progresses, Argus will apply Electrification, a stacking debuff that increases the damage you take with every hit. Each stack of Electrification increases incoming damage by 0.5%, up to a maximum of 50% at 100 stacks. Even the toughest warriors will feel the sting! Fortunately, the thunder crystals can help counteract this effect. Keep track of your current Electrification level on the personal progress bar at the top of your screen.
 

Argus grows stronger with each difficulty level, and only the boldest heroes will be able to defeat him at the highest levels! And remember: all mechanics from the Golden Sands of Almahad are fully active during the raid.

Only the most resourceful and courageous heroes stand a chance of triumphing – and living to tell the tale.

While Sanity will slowly recover on land, it's wise to manage it carefully underwater. Defeating sea monsters in the shallow waters will help restore Sanity to everyone in your party.

Once an Eye is destroyed, you'll unlock a passage to Akumai's Heart, but only a limited number of heroes can enter.

Remember, you can only leave the Heart's chamber by dying... or if your Sanity drops to zero.
